results.title: The Fat film
results.creator_credit: Frank J. Lisciandro, John Lengsfelder, Katherine Lisciandro, Image Associates and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Americans have the most fat-filled diet in the world. On an average, over 40% of the calories eaten daily by Americans are fats. A diet high in fat dramatically increases the risk of coronary heart disease, stroke, atherosclerosis, diabetes and cancer. This program outlines constructive nutritional advice for reducing fat content in our diets and thereby improving our health and decreasing our cholesterol level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank J. Lisciandro, John Lengsfelder, Katherine Lisciandro, Image Associates and Pyramid Films

results.title: The Camera image: more than a record
results.creator_credit: David Hopwood and Northern Virginia Community College. Extended Learning Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Developing image”.
This program examines the pre-history of photography, discussing the concepts of visual perspective, mechanical devices leading to the invention of the camera, and the cultural needs that generated the invention of photography. The special qualities of the camera and its artistic capabilities are discussed.

results.title: Expressing a twentieth century vision
results.creator_credit: David Hopwood and Northern Virginia Community College. Extended Learning Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Developing image”.
This program probes how the photograph has been used as a metaphor to describe the photographer’s inner state. This is in contrast to traditional approaches to realistic photography. Individual photographers discuss the use of metaphor in their own experiences and works.

results.title: The Farmer's daughter
results.creator_credit: H C Potter, Dore Schary and David O Selznick Productions
results.brief_description: Katie Holmstrom (Loretta Young in an Oscar winning performance) leaves her farm seeking a nursing career in Capitol City. She accepts a ride with sign-painter Adolph Petree, but a car accident forces them to spend a night at a motel while repairs are undertaken. Katie helps pay for damages and arrives in the City penniless. She works as a maid in the Morley household and impresses the Congressman and his family. Morley runs for re-election and wins, but his colleague dies soon after taking office, and the party nominates a political hack named Finley to replace him. Katie is furious, tells off Finley at a rally, drawing so much attention that the rival party drafts her as its darkhorse candidate, building her campaign on her refreshing honesty and openness. However, someone she once helped turns on her and threatens her new position. Co-starring Joseph Cotten, Ethel Barrymore, Charles Bickford and Rose Hobart. Adapted from the play Hulda: Daughter of Parliament by Juhni Tervata.

results.title: The Family album
results.creator_credit: David Hopwood and Northern Virginia Community College. Extended Learning Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Developing image”.
Highlights the most frequent subject of photographers past and present, the family portrait. Provides a history of family portraiture, including daguerreotypes and wet-plate photography, as well as the development of Kodak roll-film cameras. Includes interviews with leading contemporary photographers who specialise in family portraiture.

results.title: The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit glass slides (Sea Life)
results.credit_line: ACMI Collection. Donated by William Kerr on behalf of Edwin Schefferle.
results.brief_description: There are five parts to the Sea Life slides, each slide has 4 images. These small slides have red sealing tape around the edges. These slides form part of The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit with removable chimney and internal wooden block. The lantern is housed in original box with metal handle, and internal red and blue graphic for: The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit. 20 glass slides in custom box, length of textile to keep box shut, 2 small empty boxes which act to store slides in a snug manner.

results.title: Solutions to images
results.creator_credit: David Hopwood and Northern Virginia Community College. Extended Learning Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Developing image”.
This program contains a technical survey of the main photographic processes from the daguerreotype to the Kodak#1. Explores an antique tintype gallery and shows a wet-collodion negative made during the American Civil War.

results.title: The Developing image
results.creator_credit: David Hopwood and Northern Virginia Community College. Extended Learning Institute
results.brief_description: Explores the marvellous invention of the camera, using colour and music to evoke the period. This series takes viewers from the daguerreotype to wet plate to tintype and onwards examining hundreds of exemplary photographs. It dramatically depicts various themes in the history of photography.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Hopwood and Northern Virginia Community College. Extended Learning Institute

results.title: A Conversation with Wilson Bryan Key
results.creator_credit: David Hopwood and Northern Virginia Community College. Extended Learning Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Developing image”.
Dr. Key is a professor of Media Studies and president of Media Probe, a centre for the study of Media. Dr. Key attempts to awaken the public to the real message behind the innumerable photographic images which surround us. This fascinating discussion focuses on subliminal advertising, and how millions of dollars are spent each year for the solitary purpose of persuading consumers to buy a product.

results.title: Light from within
results.creator_credit: David Hopwood and Northern Virginia Community College. Extended Learning Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Developing image”.
Examines the artistic aspects of photography, comparing it with trends in modern art, and deals with early and contemporary creative photography. The trend towards graphic experimentation is examined through a discussion with contemporary photographers who are leading practitioners in their fields.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Hopwood and Northern Virginia Community College. Extended Learning Institute
